name: Coordi-Nations as a Commons-based alternative to Network States
description:
Extitutional workshop on Coordinations as a commons-based alternative to Network States. The workshop will be gathering around 20 to 30 people, who commit to participating for the whole week. Participants will include a mix of thinkers, visionaries, and practitioners involved in the theorization, conceptualisation or implementation of post-westphalian sovereign communities, at the local and global level. 

If you are interested in attending, please submit an application at the following link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfhARucL3wPZV6qJcOUWQt1mjUuBJ1Mldb7ZOw1JQrmUjDv4Q/viewform 


To give you an idea of what to expect for the schedule: 

* THEORY (May 9): Theoretical and conceptual work on post-Westphalian types of sovereignties, relationship to existing systems & institutions. 

* EMPIRICAL (May 10): Comparative analysis of previous and current attempts at implementing sovereign and post-westphalian communities

* PRACTICAL (May 11): Practical cookbook: Elaborate how to set up and manage a Coordi-Nation, similar to Balaji's step-by-step process for creating Network States. 

* TECHNICAL (May 12): Technical specification of relevant tools necessary to ensure the proper operations of these new sovereign communities.

* EXTITUTIONAL THEORY (May 13): Coordi-Nation as an alternative institutional scaffolding to support the agency of networked Nations, which transcend political authority beyond geographical boundaries.
